intro: Onosma albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed flax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Onosma albicaulis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
